Problem:
Consider the discrete-time system defined by the equation \\(y(n+1) = A y(n)\\), where A is a constant matrix. We are interested in the behavior of this system when subjected to a transformation defined by \\(g(x) = Bx\\), where B is also a constant matrix.

If \\(g(y)\\) is applied to a vector \\(y_0\\) at n = 0, and then allowed to evolve under \\(y(n+1) = A y(n)\\) without further intervention, will the state \\(y(n)\\) at n = N directly correspond to evolving \\(y_0\\) under \\(y(n+1) = A y(n)\\) till n = N?
Explanation: Applying the transformation \\(g(y) = By_0\\) modifies the initial conditions of the system. The subsequent evolution under the discrete system formula will then take this altered initial state forward, generating a trajectory different from that which would have occurred from \\(y_0\\) using only A.
